Step 2: Create the 2D sketch Two congruent rectangular faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) with following lines (curves) for each face: - line\\_1: [0, 0.3397], [0.321, 0] - line\\_2: [0.321, 0], [0.7433, 0.2003] - line\\_3: [0.7433, 0.2003], [0.6833, 0.6638] - line\\_4: [0.6833, 0.6638], [0.2239, 0.75] - line\\_5: [0.2239, 0.75], [0, 0.3397] Since the coordinate system translation vector is [0, 0, 0], you don't need to account for any translation during the 2D sketch generation. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.75. Step 4: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch The Euler angles for the 2D sketch plane rotation are [0, 0, 0]. The transformation vector for the translation of the 2D sketch plane is [0, 0, 0]. Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 (sketch\\_scale) and use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" specified in the JSON. The resulting object should have dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.5302 These instructions should result in a correct interpretation of the JSON data provided for creating the desired 3D CAD part.</description>
